bicker.helper

bicker.helper.combine_kernels(kernel_groups, b1=None, b2=None, bG2=None, c1=None, c2=None, groups=None)

Function for combing bias parameters and kernels.

Parameters

  • kernel_groups (list) – List of arrays containing kernels. Each list element should have shape (n_ker, n_samp, n_k). With n_samp being the number of predictions to be made, n_ker being the number of kernels in that group, and n_k being the number of k-values. Assumes growth rate f is inlcuded in the kernel.

  • f (array) – Array containing growth rate. Should habe shape (n_samp,).

  • b1 (array) – Array containig b1 values. Should habe shape (n_samp,). Default is None.

  • b2 (array) – Array containig b2 values. Should habe shape (n_samp,). Default is None.

  • bG2 (array) – Array containig bG2 values. Should habe shape (n_samp,). Default is None.

  • c1 (array) – Array containig c1 values. Should habe shape (n_samp,). Default is None.

  • c2 (array) – Array containig c2 values. Should habe shape (n_samp,). Default is None.

  • groups (list) – List of int that correspond to the group ids for the groups in kernel_groups. Default is None, in which case it is assumed all groups are passed.

Returns

Array containig the combined kernels and bias parameters. Each list item will have shape (n_samp, n_k).

bicker.helper.extra_bias(bias)

Function for combining bias parameters for the terms that are common for all multipoles.

Parameters

bias (array) – Array of bias parameters {b1, b2, bG2, bGamm3, b4, csl, cst}.

Returns

Array of shape (n, 3). If all bias parameters were floats n=1.

bicker.helper.group_info(group, file_list=False)
Parameters

  • group (int, str) – Group identifier. int in range 0-6, or shot.

  • file_list (bool) – If True returns list of file containing the group kernels. Default is False.

Returns

Information about the kernel group.

bicker.helper.hex_bias(bias)

Function for combining bias parameters for power spectrum quadrupole.

Parameters

bias (array) – Array of bias parameters {b1, b2, bG2, bGamm3, b4, csl, cst}.

Returns

Array of shape (n, 11). If all bias parameters were floats n=1.

bicker.helper.mono_bias(bias)

Function for combining bias parameters for power spectrum monopole.

Parameters

bias (array) – Array of bias parameters {b1, b2, bG2, bGamm3, csl}.

Returns

Array of shape (n, 16). If all bias parameters were floats n=1.

bicker.helper.powerspec_multipole(P_n, bias, multipole)

Function for computing power spectrum multipoles via a combination of bias parameters and kernels.

Parameters

  • P_n (tuple) – Tuple of arrays containing power spectrum kernels. The first element should be those kernels that are unique to multipole, the second should be those that are shared by all multipoles.

  • bias (array) – Array of bias parameters {b1, b2, bG2, bGamm3, b4, csl, cst}.

  • multipole (int) – Multipole order. Must corespond to P_n. Can be 0, 2, or 4.

Returns

Array containing power spectrum multipole predictions.

bicker.helper.quad_bias(bias)

Function for combining bias parameters for power spectrum quadrupole.

Parameters

bias (array) – Array of bias parameters {b1, b2, bG2, bGamm3, b4, csl, cst}.

Returns

Array of shape (n, 11). If all bias parameters were floats n=1.
